PlantForm: Multi stemmed shrub or small tree.
Stem: Smooth and grey to green. Erect and with swollen purplish nodes.
Leaves: Elliptic to lance shaped, up to 22 cm long, upper surface green and rough, lower surface paler and hairy. Alternately arranged in 2 rows on opposite sides of branchlets.
Flowers: White to pale yellow in spirals on spikes up to 12 cm long which droop near the tip.
FruitSeeds: Numerous berries embedded onto flower spike, green turning black when ripe, with single black seed within.
DistinguishingFeatures: Distinct, most native Piper species are vines.
